1360: ### 4.1 Softmax Concentration Bounds
1361: 
1362: :::{prf:lemma} Softmax Tail Bound

1364:

1366:

1368: \mathbb{P}(d_{\text{alg}}(i, c(i)) > R \mid \mathcal{F}_t) \leq k \cdot \exp\left(-\frac{R^2 - R_{\max}^2}{2\varepsilon_c^2}\right)

hints.label: proof-lem-softmax-tail-corrected-full
hints.content:
1376: :label: proof-lem-softmax-tail-corrected-full
1377: 
1378: **Step 1: Partition function lower bound.**
1379: 
1380: By {prf:ref}`lem-companion-availability-enforcement`, there exists $\ell^* \in \mathcal{A} \setminus \{i\}$ with $d_{\text{alg}}(i, \ell^*) \leq R_{\max}$.
1381: 
1382: Therefore:
1383: 
1384: $$
1385: Z_i = \sum_{\ell \in \mathcal{A} \setminus \{i\}} \exp\left(-\frac{d_{\text{alg}}^2(i,\ell)}{2\varepsilon_c^2}\right) \geq \exp\left(-\frac{R_{\max}^2}{2\varepsilon_c^2}\right) = \exp\left(-\frac{C_{\text{comp}}^2}{2}\right) =: Z_{\min} > 0
1386: 
1387: $$
1388: 
1389: **Step 2: Tail probability.**
1390: 
1391: For $R > R_{\max}$:
1392: 
1393: $$
1394: \begin{aligned}
1395: \mathbb{P}(d_{\text{alg}}(i,c(i)) > R)
1396: &= \sum_{\ell : d(i,\ell) > R} \frac{\exp(-d^2(i,\ell)/(2\varepsilon_c^2))}{Z_i} \\
1397: &\leq \frac{k \cdot \exp(-R^2/(2\varepsilon_c^2))}{Z_{\min}} \\
1398: &= k \cdot \exp\left(-\frac{R^2 - R_{\max}^2}{2\varepsilon_c^2}\right)
1399: \end{aligned}
1400: 
1401: $$

hints.title: Effective Interaction Radius
hints.content:
1407: :label: cor-effective-interaction-radius-full
1408: 
1409: Define the **effective interaction radius** by setting the tail probability to $\delta = 1/k$:
1410: 
1411: $$
1412: R_{\text{eff}} = \sqrt{R_{\max}^2 + 2\varepsilon_c^2 \log(k^2)} = \varepsilon_c \sqrt{C_{\text{comp}}^2 + 2\log(k^2)}
1413: 
1414: $$
1415: 
1416: Then:
1417: 
1418: $$
1419: \mathbb{P}(d_{\text{alg}}(i, c(i)) > R_{\text{eff}}) \leq \frac{1}{k}
1420: 
1421: $$

hints.title: Effective Companion Count
hints.content:
1457: :label: lem-effective-companion-count-corrected-full
1458: 
1459: Under {prf:ref}`assump-uniform-density-full`, the effective number of companions within $R_{\text{eff}}$ is:
1460: 
1461: $$
1462: k_{\text{eff}}(i) := \sum_{\ell \in \mathcal{A} \setminus \{i\}} \mathbb{1}_{d_{\text{alg}}(i,\ell) \leq R_{\text{eff}}} \leq \rho_{\max} \cdot C_{\text{vol}} \cdot R_{\text{eff}}^{2d}
1463: 
1464: $$
1465: 
1466: Substituting $R_{\text{eff}} = \mathcal{O}(\varepsilon_c \sqrt{\log k})$:
1467: 
1468: $$
1469: k_{\text{eff}}(i) = \mathcal{O}(\varepsilon_c^{2d} \cdot (\log k)^d)
1470: 
1471: $$

hints.label: lem-softmax-derivative-locality-full
hints.title: Exponential Locality of Softmax Derivatives
hints.content:
1508: :label: lem-softmax-derivative-locality-full
1509: 
1510: For the softmax companion selection with temperature $\varepsilon_c$, all derivatives of the companion probability satisfy:
1511: 
1512: $$
1513: \left|\nabla^\alpha_{x_i} P(c(j) = \ell \mid \mathcal{F}_t)\right| \leq C_{|\alpha|} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{-2|\alpha|} \cdot P(c(j) = \ell \mid \mathcal{F}_t) \cdot \exp\left(-\frac{d_{\text{alg}}^2(j, \ell)}{4\varepsilon_c^2}\right)
1514: 
1515: $$
1516: 
1517: where $C_{|\alpha|} = O(|\alpha|!)$ (Gevrey-1 growth) and the bound is **k-uniform**.
hints.raw_directive:
1505: The previous sections established exponential concentration for the **probabilities** $P(c(i) = \ell)$. We now prove that **derivatives** of these probabilities also decay exponentially.
1506: 
1507: :::{prf:lemma} Exponential Locality of Softmax Derivatives
1508: :label: lem-softmax-derivative-locality-full
1509: 
1510: For the softmax companion selection with temperature $\varepsilon_c$, all derivatives of the companion probability satisfy:
1511: 
1512: $$
1513: \left|\nabla^\alpha_{x_i} P(c(j) = \ell \mid \mathcal{F}_t)\right| \leq C_{|\alpha|} \cdot \varepsilon_c^{-2|\alpha|} \cdot P(c(j) = \ell \mid \mathcal{F}_t) \cdot \exp\left(-\frac{d_{\text{alg}}^2(j, \ell)}{4\varepsilon_c^2}\right)
1514: 
1515: $$
1516: 
1517: where $C_{|\alpha|} = O(|\alpha|!)$ (Gevrey-1 growth) and the bound is **k-uniform**.
1518:

hints.label: proof-lem-softmax-derivative-locality-full
hints.content:
1523: :label: proof-lem-softmax-derivative-locality-full
1524: 
1525: **Step 1: Structure of softmax probability.**
1526: 
1527: $$
1528: P(c(j) = \ell) = \frac{\exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(j,\ell)/(2\varepsilon_c^2))}{\sum_{\ell' \in \mathcal{A} \setminus \{j\}} \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(j,\ell')/(2\varepsilon_c^2))} =: \frac{K_j^\ell}{Z_j}
1529: 
1530: $$
1531: 
1532: where $K_j^\ell = \exp(-d_{\text{alg}}^2(j,\ell)/(2\varepsilon_c^2))$ and $Z_j = \sum_{\ell'} K_j^{\ell'}$.
1533: 
1534: **Step 2: First derivative via quotient rule.**
1535: 
1536: $$
1537: \nabla_{x_i} P(c(j) = \ell) = \frac{(\nabla_{x_i} K_j^\ell) \cdot Z_j - K_j^\ell \cdot (\nabla_{x_i} Z_j)}{Z_j^2}
1538: 
1539: $$
1540: 
1541: For the Gaussian kernel:
1542: 
1543: $$
1544: \nabla_{x_i} K_j^\ell = K_j^\ell \cdot \nabla_{x_i} \left(-\frac{d_{\text{alg}}^2(j,\ell)}{2\varepsilon_c^2}\right) = -\frac{K_j^\ell}{\varepsilon_c^2} \cdot d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell) \cdot \nabla_{x_i} d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell)
1545: 
1546: $$
1547: 
1548: By {prf:ref}`lem-dalg-derivative-bounds-full`, $\|\nabla_{x_i} d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell)\| \leq 1$. Therefore:
1549: 
1550: $$
1551: \|\nabla_{x_i} K_j^\ell\| \leq \frac{d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell)}{\varepsilon_c^2} \cdot K_j^\ell \leq \frac{1}{\varepsilon_c} \cdot K_j^\ell
1552: 
1553: $$
1554: 
1555: (using $d_{\text{alg}}/\varepsilon_c \ll 1$ for effective contributors).
1556: 
1557: **Step 3: Partition function derivative.**
1558: 
1559: $$
1560: \nabla_{x_i} Z_j = \sum_{\ell' \neq j} \nabla_{x_i} K_j^{\ell'} = -\frac{1}{\varepsilon_c^2} \sum_{\ell'} K_j^{\ell'} \cdot d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell') \cdot \nabla_{x_i} d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell')
1561: 
1562: $$
1563: 
1564: **Key observation**: If $i = j$ or $i = \ell$, the derivative acts directly on the exponential. If $i \neq j, \ell$, the derivative couples through the N-body softmax structure. However, by exponential concentration:
1565: 
1566: $$
1567: \|\nabla_{x_i} Z_j\| \leq \frac{k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)}}{\varepsilon_c^2} \cdot Z_j \leq \frac{C_{\text{eff}}}{\varepsilon_c^2} \cdot Z_j
1568: 
1569: $$
1570: 
1571: where $k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)} = O(\rho_{\max} \varepsilon_c^{2d} (\log k)^d)$ grows logarithmically with $k$.
1572: 
1573: **Step 4: Assemble first derivative bound.**
1574: 
1575: $$
1576: |\nabla_{x_i} P(c(j) = \ell)| \leq \frac{|\nabla K_j^\ell| \cdot Z_j + K_j^\ell \cdot |\nabla Z_j|}{Z_j^2} \leq \frac{C_1}{\varepsilon_c^2} \cdot P(c(j) = \ell)
1577: 
1578: $$
1579: 
1580: where $C_1 = O(1 + k_{\text{eff}}^{(\varepsilon_c)})$ contains the $(\log k)^d$ factor, which is **absorbed into higher-order Gevrey-1 constants** (see §7.1 for how derivative locality prevents this from affecting k-uniformity).
1581: 
1582: **Step 5: Higher derivatives by induction.**
1583: 
1584: For $|\alpha| \geq 2$, apply Faà di Bruno formula to $\nabla^\alpha \log P = \nabla^\alpha (\log K_j^\ell - \log Z_j)$. Each term has structure:
1585: 
1586: $$
1587: \nabla^\alpha K_j^\ell = K_j^\ell \cdot \text{(polynomial of degree } |\alpha| \text{ in } d_{\text{alg}}, \nabla d_{\text{alg}}, \ldots)
1588: 
1589: $$
1590: 
1591: By {prf:ref}`lem-dalg-derivative-bounds-full`, $\|\nabla^m d_{\text{alg}}\| \leq C_m \varepsilon_d^{1-m}$. For $\varepsilon_d \ll \varepsilon_c$ (typical), the dominant factor is $\varepsilon_c^{-2|\alpha|}$ from repeated differentiation of the exponential.
1592: 
1593: Exponential decay: The softmax structure ensures that walkers with $d_{\text{alg}}(j,\ell) > R_{\text{eff}}$ contribute $\exp(-R_{\text{eff}}^2/(2\varepsilon_c^2))$ to probabilities and $\exp(-R_{\text{eff}}^2/(4\varepsilon_c^2))$ to derivatives (from quotient rule cancellations). This provides the claimed **double exponential suppression** for distant walkers.
